summary: Background Newcastle disease virus (NDV) is a contagious fatal viral disease affecting most species of birds. the virus is a single-stranded negative sense RNA virus that belongs to the genus Avulavirus within the Paramyxoviridae family. endemic to many countries, most notably in domestic poultry due to their high susceptibility. virion proteomics (the protein composition of the purified virus particles) becomes a useful tool in global evaluation. the most well studied RNA virus is retrovirus human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) only a few enveloped RNA viruses have been analyzed by virion proteomics. virion proteomics have been used extensively to analyze the composition of a variety of virions, leading to a more complete picture of the viral particle. however, to the best of our knowledge there is no mention of incorporation of host proteins in the enveloped-virus NDV so far. the purity of NDV La Sota was confirmed by electron microscopy analysis. the purified NDV particles were separated by sodium dodecylsulfate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. gels were stained with silver and processed for image analysis. a total of 45 protein spots were detected on the silver stained gel. a total of 45 protein spots were detected on the gel. IV pI. f MASCOT protein score (based on combined MS and MS/MS spectra) of greater than 64 (p 0.05) or the total ion score (based on MS/MS spectra) of greater than 30 (p 0.05) these proteins were functionally categorized with biological processes according to Uniprot knowledgebase. 8 g of purified virions from allantoic fluid (AF) and 15 g of proteins extracted from the normal 13-day-old specific pathogen free (SPF) chicken embryo eggs were subjected to western blot analysis with antibodies against the following proteins. virions were subjected to digestion with bromelain and then incubated with antibodies against HN protein of NDV La Sota strain. high purified NDV La Sota particles were immunogold labeled with antibodies against (A) normal mouse IgG, (B) Actin, (C) HN, (D) Hsp90, (E) Ezrin. the labeled virus were then negatively stained by 2% sodium phosphotungstate and visualized by electron microscopy (30,000 magnifications) the purity of NDV La Sota was confirmed by electron microscopy analysis. the purified NDV particles were separated by sodium dodecylsulfate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. three repeats of independent sample preparations and three repeats of independent 2-DE were performed under identical conditions. a total of 45 protein spots were detected on the silver stained gel. 96/8.56 232 7 E NDV HN Viral protein AAC28376 63213/7.13 105 6 1 cytoskeletal proteins, two molecular chaperones, four chromatin modifying proteins, three enzymes-binding proteins, two calcium-binding proteins, two metabolism proteins, two signal transduction-associated proteins, two tumor-associated proteins. the proteins extracted from normal 13-day-old SPF embryonated eggs were included as a positive control. 8 g of purified virions from allantoic fluid (AF) and 15 g of proteins extracted from the normal 13-day-old specific pathogen free (SPF) chicken embryo eggs were subjected to western blot analysis. virions were subjected to digestion with bromelain and incubated with antibodies against HN protein of NDV La Sota strain. high purified NDV La Sota particles were immunogold labeled with antibodies against (A) normal mouse IgG, (B) Actin, (C) HN, (D) Hsp90, (E) Ezrin. labeled virus were then negatively stained by 2% sodium phosphotungstate and visualized by electron microscopy. a significant number of proteins have been reported to be present in virions of other virus families, such as herpes viruses, poxviruses and retroviruses. the most likely explanation is that these host proteins play a role in the entry and release stages of the virus life cycle. annexins are a well-known multigene family of ca2+ regulated phospholipid-binding proteins with diverse functions. the presence of annexin A2 is thought to support viral binding, fusion and replication. annexin A2 is thought to support viral binding, fusion and replication. in this study, we identified two molecular chaperones incorporated into purified NDV particles, HSP70 and HSP90. they may be involved in the assembly of adenovirus [41], enterovirus [42], vaccinia virus [43] and hantaan virus [44]. HSP70 may participate in early events of infection, uncoating the viral capsid in a manner similar to its role in the uncoating of clathrin cages[ three enzymes-binding proteins were identified, including tyrosine 3-monooxygenase/tryptophan 5-monooxygenase activation protein, zeta polypeptide, epsilon polypeptide and theta polypeptide. two calcium-binding proteins, calcium-binding protein A6 and A11 were associated with the purified NDV particles. a better understanding of cellular proteins in NDV virions may provide novel targets for the design of antiviral drugs as well as vaccines. a better understanding of cellular proteins in NDV virions may provide novel targets for the design of antiviral drugs. diluted in 1 ml of TNE buffer, centrifuged at 24,100 rpm for 2 h at 4°C in a rotor to exclude the residuary sucrose. purified virus pellet stored at 80°C for further use. the IPG strips were rehydrated with 400 l rehydration buffer (7 M urea, 2 M thiourea, 2% (w/v) CHAPS, 65 mM DTT, 0.2% IPG buffer pH 3–10) the strips were incubated for 15 min with gentle shaking in an equilibration buffer. the gels were stained by the modified silver staining method compatible with MS [75] and scanned at a resolution of 600 dpi using the Image scanner (Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) Spot detection, spot matching, and quantitative intensity analysis were performed using Image Master 2D Platinum 5.0 according to the manufacture’s protocol. hydroxy-trans-cinnamic acid (-CCA, Sigma) in 50% ACN containing 0.1% TFA. digested proteins (0.8 l) of each sample were spotted onto target plates and allowed to air-dry at RT. extracts from 13-day-old SPF embryonated eggs were designed as a positive control. AF from 13-day-old SPF embryonated eggs performed with the same protocol as the purification of NDV virions was used as a negative control. protease treatment of NDV virions Purified virus particles equivalent to 50 g protein was incubated with bromelain (BB0243, BBI) at 0.2 mg/ml in 50 mM DTT (pH 7.2) in Dulbecco’s phosphate buffered saline (PBS) at 37°C for 15 min. samples were centrifuged to equilibrium in 11.5 ml non-linear 20%-60% sucrose-T the sample was blocked with 5% BSA in PBS-Tween 20 (pH 7.4) for 30 min at RT. all grids were then blocked with blocking buffer (5% BSA, 5% normal serum, 0.1% cold water skin gelatin, 10 mM phosphate buffer, 150 mM NaCl, pH 7.4) after washing with PBS, immobilized virions were incubated for 1.5 h. purified virus pellet was resuspended in a 70Ti rotor at 4°C. it was then loaded on a sucrose density gradient (20%, 30%, 40%, 50%, and 60% W/V) the collected banded viruses were purified for a second time according to same purification procedure. two-dimensional gel electrophoresis (2-DE) separation of proteins of purified NDV particles. purified NDV particles were dissolved in 500 l virus lysis buffer. lysates were clarified by centrifugation at 12,000 g for 30 min at 4°C. the IPG strips were incubated for 15 min with gentle shaking in an equilibration buffer (6 M urea, 30% glycerol, 2% SDS and 0.375 M Tris–HCl, pH 8.8) the gels were stained by the modified silver staining method compatible with MS [75]. the supernatant was collected and transferred into a 200 l microcentrifuge tube. the gels were extracted once with extraction buffer (67% ACN containing 5% trifluoroacetic acid (TFA, Wako) at 37°C for 1 h. as the digestion enzyme, one missed cleavage site, partial modification of cysteine carboamidomethylated and methionine oxidized, none fixed modifications, MS tolerance of 60 ppm, MS/MS tolerance of 0.25 Da. the critical challenge of virion proteomics was to prove that the host proteins were really an integral part of the virions and are not just non-specifically attached to the outside of the virions. the viral proteins were transferred onto a polyvinylidene fluoride membrane (PVDF, P/N 66485, BioTrace, Pall Corporation) the membrane was blocked in freshly prepared 5% bovine serum albumin (BSA) with 0.05% Tween-20 for 2 h at RT with constant agitation. the membrane washed three times with Tris buffered saline buffer (TBS) plus 0.2% Tween-20. antibody against chicken IgG (15 nm Gold) (ab41500), goat polyclonal against rabbit IgG (5 nm Gold) (ab27235) and goat polyclonal against mouse IgG (10 nm Gold) were purchased from abcam. authors’ contributions XR performed the main proteomic experiments and data analysis. YB and YC conceived study and participated in its design, coordination and helped to sketch the manuscript. we would like to thank Dr George Dacai Liu for critical discussion, comments and revision of the manuscript.
